title: General Electric Earnings beat, Revenue misses In Q3
text:
© Reuters. General Electric Earnings beat, Revenue misses In Q3

Investing.com - General Electric (NYSE: ) reported third quarter that beat analysts' expectations on Wednesday and revenue that fell short of forecasts.

The firm reported earnings per share of $0.15 on revenue of $23.36B. Analysts polled by Investing.com forecast EPS of $0.12 on revenue of $28.9B. That compared to EPS of $0.14 on revenue of $29.57B in the same period a year earlier. The company had reported EPS of $0.17 on revenue of $28.83B in the previous quarter.

For the year, General Electric shares are up 24.59%, outperforming the S&P Global (NYSE: ) 100 which is up 18.66% year to date.

General Electric follows other major Capital Goods sector earnings this month

On Wednesday, October 23, 2019, Boeing reported third quarter EPS of $1.45 on revenue of $19.98B, compared to forecasts of EPS of $2.07 on revenue of $19.6B.

Honeywell earnings beat analyst's expectations on Thursday, October 17, 2019, with third quarter EPS of $2.08 on revenue of $9.09B. Investing.com analysts expected EPS of $2.01 on revenue of $9.12B

Stay up-to-date on all of the upcoming earnings reports by visiting Investing.com's earnings calendar
description: General Electric Earnings beat, Revenue misses In Q3
